newsitem.title: UK: Princess Diana charity dress catalogue sets record.
newsitem.headline: Princess Diana charity dress catalogue sets record.

text.p: The charity sale of Princess Diana's dresses has already set a record -- almost 7,000 catalogues have been sold.
Eighty of her most famous robes are being put on sale next month in New York to raise money for AIDS and cancer research.
The auctioneers Christie's said on Friday they have had record demand for the catalogue, which comes in variously priced editions.
Sales have reached almost 7,000 and raised 512,000 pounds ($834,555).
The catalogue, already a collector's item through the advance orders, contains portraits by Lord Snowdon of Diana wearing some of the dresses up for sale. Designer sketches are also included.
The June 25 auction at Christie's New York salesroom in Manhattan will be attended by 1,100 people who will be chosen by lottery due to heavy demand.
